alert.note: Alert for Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 5:07AM EST until December 19 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Significant flooding of the Pleasant River caused by excessive rainfall runoff is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Maine, including the following county, Piscataquis. * WHEN...Until 915 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of the Pleasant River impacting flood-prone locations in Brownville to Milo is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 502 AM EST, local fire departments reporting a water rescue in Milo at the Medford Road. In addition, evacuations have taken place in Brownville Junction near the river. In, Brownville 4 to 5 feet of water covering Route 11 in Brownville Junction near Fisher Ave at the Pleasant River. In Milo, 1 foot of flooding and rising is occuring at the Medford Road near Pleasant Street. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brownville Junction, Milo, Ebeemee, Brownville, Sebec, Williamsburg and Katahdin Iron Works. - For flood safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
